intro: Lampranthus liberalis, commonly known as the rainbow bush, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant produces striking, colorful flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Lampranthus liberalis is drought-tolerant and requires minimal care once established.
